definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: Intelligent Anti-Tampering System communicate with teminal which using 101 protocol.
sentences.chinese: 智能防窃电主站系统采用101规约与专变终端通讯。

sentences.english: They are so conventionalized that speakers may not be conscious of their being metaphorical.
sentences.chinese: 他们是如此规约，发言可能不会意识到自己正在隐喻。

sentences.english: According to this view, meaning is based on conventionalized conceptual structures.
sentences.chinese: 根据这种观点，意思是根据规约的概念结构。

sentences.english: Refusal strategies in foreign trade correspondence can be divided into direct refusals and conventional refusals.
sentences.chinese: 外贸函电的拒绝策略分为直接策略和规约策略。

sentences.english: This article focuses on document-based requirements, such as use case specifications.
sentences.chinese: 本文关注于基于文档的需求，比如用例需求规约。

sentences.english: This Statute does not prescribe the rights and duties of belligerentsand neutrals in time of war.
sentences.chinese: 本规约不规范战时交战国和中立国的权利和义务。

sentences.english: And folk legends offer convenience for the transmission and retainment of folk beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 规约民间传说叙事变化的重要内容是民间信仰。

definition: to state in writing (laws, rules etc)
to regulate/rules and regulations/regulatory/style and structure (esp. of building)
